items.title: Football transfer rumours: Murillo to replace Maguire at Manchester United?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs rumours might even get home one day This year, as with last year, Aston Villa are eyeing the January market to bolster their forward line. For Marcus Rashford in 2025, read Tammy Abraham in 2026. Roma own his registration, though he is now on loan at Besiktas. A fan favourite when on loan from Chelsea in Villa‚Äôs Championship days, such a move would be something of a homecoming. Another Villa target is Dani Ceballos, the midfielder once of Arsenal, and a useful Real Madrid squad player for years now. To compound Crystal Palace‚Äôs FA Cup misery, and the unsettling tidings on Oliver Glasner‚Äôs future, there‚Äôs the rumour that Jean-Philippe Mateta is a target for Juventus. Continue reading...

items.title: Reijnders: 'We hebben er eerlijk gezegd best vertrouwen in Arsenal in te halen'
items.summary: Tijjani Reijnders heeft de Engelse titelstrijd nog lang niet uit zijn hoofd gezet. Door de matige resultaten van de afgelopen weken heeft Manchester City een achterstand van zes punten op koploper Arsenal opgelopen. Toch heeft hij er vertrouwen in de koppositie te kunnen heroveren.

items.title: Officieel: Roma huurt Malen met optie tot koop van Aston Villa
items.summary: Donyell Malen heeft zijn transfer naar AS Roma afgerond. Zoals VI al meldde, komt de 26-jarige aanvaller op huurbasis over van Aston Villa. Als Roma zich kwalificeert voor Europees voetbal, wordt die overstap komende zomer definitief.

items.title: African football chiefs accused of not consulting fully over controversial Afcon change
items.summary: Tournament to be played every four years from 2028 Federation denies statutes breached in making decision The Confederation of African Football (Caf) has been accused of pushing through its controversial decision to stage the Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) every four years without properly consulting member federations. Several presidents of African football federations have told the Guardian they were not informed of the decision until it was surprisingly announced by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, on 20 December, prompting claims that the confederation breached its statutes by failing to seek approval at a general assembly. Continue reading...

items.title: Cardiff boss Barry-Murphy: Hopefully I can deliver for Vincent Tan, or else...
items.summary: The January transfer window is open and clubs up and down the land are looking for new players. But it's all quiet at Cardiff.

items.title: Emmen-coach Menno van Dam stelt zich voor: 'Ik laat spelers nadenken'
items.summary: Menno van Dam (42) is sinds afgelopen zomer hoofdtrainer van Emmen. Een onbekende naam in het trainersgilde, die meters maakte in Denemarken. Met de Drenten mikt Van Dam op de play-offs. ‚ÄòDie gaan we halen.‚Äô

items.title: F√†bregas lacht na opvallende uitspraak: 'Ik ben nog steeds geen Serie A-niveau'
items.summary: Cesc F√†bregas heeft donderdag zijn meerdere moeten erkennen in Massimiliano Allegri. De Spaanse trainer verloor met zijn Como van het AC Milan van Allegri. Na afloop werd hij geconfronteerd met zijn opvallende uitspraak van voor de wedstrijd.

items.title: Sparta-talent droomt van WK: 'Gelijk een goaltje maken tegen Spanje'
items.summary: Van Het Kasteel naar het WK in Mexico, Canada en de Verenigde Staten. Dat is waar Ayoni Santos (20) hardop van droomt. De Nederlandse middenvelder met Kaapverdische roots maakte donderdag zijn eerste doelpunt in dienst van Sparta Rotterdam.

items.title: Danish star Rune: Tennis has become unnecessarily demanding
items.summary: Holger Rune has hit out at tennis' money-makers, calling for "adjustments in the scheduling" and labelled the expanded Masters 1000 events as unnecessarily demanding..

items.title: Win or bust? Under-pressure Spurs boss Frank faces crunch West Ham clash
items.summary: Thomas Frank faces the most pivotal game of his Tottenham tenure on Saturday.

items.title: Red Bull expect 'to be trailing' rivals at start of 2026 F1 season
items.summary: Red Bull chief Laurent Mekies has admitted he expects the team "to be trailing" their front-running rivals at the start of the 2026 Formula 1 season.

items.title: Carrick 'right choice at this moment' - Rooney
items.summary: Wayne Rooney says caretaker head coach Michael Carrick is the "right choice at this moment in time" to "steady the ship" at Manchester United.

items.title: From Fiji to Latvia - are cross-border leagues the future?
items.summary: The OFC Professional League kicks off this week and a Baltic League has been proposed, so is there a future for cross-border football competitions?

items.title: Defending champion Taylor holds share of lead at PGA Tour opener in Hawaii
items.summary: Defending champion Nick Taylor earned a share of the lead at eight under alongside Kevin Roy after day one of the PGA Tour season opener at the Sony Open in Hawaii.

items.title: 'Head coach' vs. 'manager': What's the difference? Does it matter?
items.summary: Who would be a football manager? As it turns out in the Premier League, an increasing number of head coaches. Just ask Enzo Maresca and Ruben Amorim.

items.title: Why did Man United, Chelsea, Real Madrid all sack their managers? It's about culture
items.summary: Why have three of the biggest soccer teams in the world fired their managers in the span of just 12 days?

items.title: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend
items.summary: Chelsea need to avoid long-throw blues, plus: a vacant spot for Liverpool and West Ham‚Äôs best hope for survival Race for the golden boot: Premier League top scorers Can the 198th derby be any spicier for Manchester United and their latest interim manager, Michael Carrick? This is his second caretaker tenure though the three games of November-December 2021 (beating Villarreal and Arsenal, drawing with Chelsea) hardly compares to sending out an XI to try to beat Manchester City in Saturday‚Äôs early kick-off. Pep Guardiola‚Äôs high-performing unit remain in contention on all fronts. Carrick takes charge of a United suffering the aftershocks of a latest manager sacking, hoping to salvage the season via European qualification. The lad from Wallsend has 17 games to do so ‚Äì his new team are in seventh place on 32 points, so victory over City would be a fine start. But you wonder if the match might end with Carrick and United humbled or, even worse, humiliated. Jamie Jackson Manchester United v Manchester City, Saturday 12.30pm (all times GMT) Chelsea v Brentford, Saturday 3pm Leeds v Fulham, Saturday 3pm Liverpool v Burnley, Saturday 3pm Continue reading...

items.title: Man Utd's Mart√≠nez: Wanted to quit after ACL tear
items.summary: Manchester United defender Lisandro Mart√≠nez has revealed that during the darkest moments of his recovery from a torn ACL, he seriously considered walking away from football.

items.title: Pulisic stays on bench as Rabiot inspires Milan win
items.summary: AC Milan won 3-1 at in-form Como on Thursday, with Adrien Rabiot winning a penalty and then scoring two goals.

items.title: Mexico calls up dual-nationals Ledezma, Guti√©rrez
items.summary: United States-Mexico dual-nationals Richard Ledezma and Brian Guti√©rrez earned their first call-ups for Mexico's senior national team on Thursday ahead of non-FIFA date friendlies against Panama on Jan. 22 and Bolivia on Jan 25.
